etymology.description: 堂(堂) (táng, "hall") + 食(食) (shí, "eat") = to eat in a hall or establishment, referring to dining in a restaurant.
etymology.interpretation: The term 堂食(堂食) (tángshí, "eat in") refers to the act of dining in at a restaurant or food establishment, as opposed to taking food out. 堂(堂) (táng, "hall") suggests a formal space, like a dining hall, while 食(食) (shí, "eat") indicates the action taking place within that space. This combination identifies the setting and activity specifically as an indoor dining experience.

examples.chinese: 我今天选择堂食(我今天選擇堂食)。
examples.english: Today I choose to eat in.

examples.chinese: 饭店推出堂食服务(飯店推出堂食服務)，吸引了许多客户(吸引了許多客戶)。
examples.pinyin: Fàndiàn tuīchū tángshí fúwù, xīyǐnle xǔduō kèhù.
examples.english: The restaurant launched an eat-in service, attracting many customers.

examples.chinese: 因为外卖不方便(因爲外賣不方便)，所以我们决定堂食(所以我們決定堂食)。
examples.pinyin: Yīnwèi wàimài bú fāngbiàn, suǒyǐ wǒmen juédìng tángshí.
examples.english: Because takeout is inconvenient, we decided to eat in.
